definition: gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi
pad/cushion/mat/to pad out/to fill a gap/to pay for sb/to advance (money)

sentences.english: We took a hovercraft across the English Channel.
sentences.chinese: 我們乘氣墊船橫渡英吉利海峽。

sentences.english: The air-cushion vehicles lift/propulsion system is a complicated and non-linear system.
sentences.chinese: 氣墊船墊升推進系統是一個複雜的非線性系統。

sentences.english: What advantages has the hovercraft over the aeroplane?
sentences.chinese: 氣墊船有什麼優於飛機的地方？

sentences.english: So you want your very own hovercraft?
sentences.chinese: 你想擁有自己的氣墊船麼？

sentences.english: Look, I can be a hovercraft.
sentences.chinese: 這是我第一次看見氣墊船。

sentences.english: You could take China's first tourist hovercraft and enjoy a very intereting trip on the Yellow River.
sentences.chinese: 您可以乘坐中國第一艘旅遊氣墊船暢遊黃河。

sentences.english: Why can a hydrofoil move on a layer of air?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼氣墊船能靠後方的氣流移動？

sentences.english: Might a new generation of airships soon be ready for launch?
sentences.chinese: 也許新一代的空氣墊船將蓄勢待發。

sentences.english: I ask my friend what is hovercraft , and then they show me its picture.
sentences.chinese: 我問朋友什麼是氣墊船，然後他們給我看了它的照片。

sentences.english: Why do i have to use a hovercraft ?
These days many people take their cars across the Channel on a hovercraft.
sentences.chinese: 現在許多人用氣墊船把汽車運過海峽。

sentences.english: These hovercrafts can easily outpace most boats.
sentences.chinese: 這些氣墊船能輕易超過大多數小船。

sentences.english: I still don't understand how hovercraft works.
sentences.chinese: 我還是不懂氣墊船怎麼工作。

sentences.english: Set the hovercraft on a level table.
sentences.chinese: 將氣墊船放置在水平桌面上。

sentences.english: Then I went and bought a hovercraft a couple of years ago.
sentences.chinese: 後來我在一兩年前又買了一艘水陸兩用氣墊船。

sentences.english: The plane is the fast but the hovercraft more comfortable.
sentences.chinese: 乘飛機最快，但是乘氣墊船更舒服。

definition: see 驚慌失措|惊慌失措[jing1 huang1 shi1 cuo4]
to whisper to one another's ear
to spike the ball (volleyball etc)/to smash (tennis etc)
to gesticulate/to make lively gestures (while talking)/also written 比手劃腳|比手划脚
to charge/to pounce on/to swoop down on
38th parallel, forming the DMZ border between North and South Korea
